channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Powell says Fed has made 'quite a bit of progress' on inflation but needs more confidence before cutting
item.description: "We've made quite a bit of progress and in bringing inflation back down to our target," Powell said at a central banking forum in Sintra, Portugal.

item.title: 'It's not just Taylor Swift': ECB's Lagarde says Eras Tour is not alone in keeping euro zone inflation high
item.description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said that Taylor Swift's Eras Tour is not alone in keeping inflation high across the euro zone.

item.title: France's Macron made key mistakes and demonized the left, says bestselling economist Thomas Piketty
item.description: Thomas Piketty, bestselling French economist, pointed to what he described as one of Macron's biggest mistakes: neglecting and demonizing France's left wing.

item.title: Peloton staved off the cash crunch that threatened its business. Where does it go now?
item.description: Peloton's looming debt pile raised concerns that the company could be pushed into bankruptcy. Now that Peloton has refinanced, it still has to fix its strategy.

item.title: Greece becomes first EU country to introduce a six-day working week
item.description: Greece has introduced a six-day working week for some businesses, seeking to boost productivity and employment in the southern European country.

item.title: What a new Labour government will mean for the UK's foreign policy
item.description: The incoming U.K. government will confront a complex international landscape once Britons head to the polls on July 4.

item.title: Tesla shares soar on better-than-expected Q2 deliveries report
item.description: Tesla's delivery numbers for the second quarter beat Wall Street estimates.

item.title: History suggests bitcoin will likely hit a new all-time high this year, report says
item.description: Bitcoin has not reached the top of its current cycle and is likely to go past its all-time high this year, according to a research report by CCData.

item.title: Revolut CEO confident on UK bank license approval as fintech firm hits record $545 million profit
item.description: Revolut's CEO Nikolay Storonsky said he is optimistic about the fintech firm's chances of being granted a U.K. banking license.

item.title: Gen Z is ditching dating apps to meet people in real life. Here are 4 top tips.
item.description: Tech-savvy Gen Zers are not experienced with interacting with people in real life. Two relationship experts offer tips on how to navigate the dating scene in person.

item.title: Markets will be 'upset' if new French government does not commit to fiscal rules, European Central Bank's vice-president says
item.description: "What we have seen so far is that the evolution of [French] markets has been quite orderly," the vice president of the European Central Bank told CNBC.

item.title: Euro zone inflation eases to 2.5% as core print misses estimate
item.description: Economists polled by Reuters expected the headline rate to come in at 2.5%.

item.title: Americans and Japanese take far less time off â€” but Europeans say they're more 'vacation deprived'
item.description: Some 84% of Germans and 69% of French workers said they feel "vacation deprived" even though they take the most days off work, according to an Expedia study.

item.title: Hungaryâ€™s Prime Minister Orban â€” a key Putin ally â€” makes first wartime visit to Ukraine
item.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is widely viewed as Russia's closest ally within the European Union and is a vocal critic of NATO's support for Kyiv.

item.title: China's young people are 'revenge saving' even as Gen Zers around the world are piling up debt
item.description: Rather than splurging on impulsive purchases, China's young are saving ferociously as the world's second-largest economy remains in the doldrums.Â

item.title: Iran faces runoff election between reformist and ultra-conservative presidential candidates amid record low turnout
item.description: Amid record-low voter turnout of around 40% in the election's first round Friday, two dramatically different candidates came out on top.

item.title: Enough is enough: Japanese airlines clamp down on abusive travelers
item.description: Amid rising uncivility, Japan Airlines and All Nippon Airways outline the behaviors that constitute "customer harassment" of their staff members.

item.title: A phobia specialist shares his 3 top tips to overcome any fear from spiders to public speaking
item.description: A phobia specialist shared three top tips to recondition your brain when facing an irrational fear including changing your internal dialogues and feelings.

item.title: Millennials are â€˜very ill-preparedâ€™ to be the richest generation in history, wealth manager says
item.description: Millennials are purportedly poised to be the wealthiest generation in history, but are they ready to handle the vast inflow of money?

item.title: Chinese EV companies Zeekr and Nio report record deliveries in June
item.description: Chinese electric car company Zeekr delivered the most cars in the first half of the year among U.S.-listed Chinese companies only selling pure electric cars.

item.title: Supreme Court rules Trump has immunity for 'official acts,' limits evidence and reach of special counsel's election case
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is charged with illegally conspiring to overturn his loss to President Joe Biden in the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Collapsed bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox is about to unload $9 billion of coins onto the market. Here's what it means
item.description: Bitcoin investors are spooked by anticipation of an imminent Mt. Gox payout to victims of a 2014 hack on the exchange that led to its collapse.

item.title: Chewy shares fall nearly 7% as the boost from Roaring Kitty's new stake diminishes
item.description: The filing showed Roaring Kitty, whose legal name is Keith Gill, bought just over 9 million shares â€” amounting to a 6.6% stake in the company.

item.title: After France's right-wing surge, parties seen scrambling to block a National Rally win
item.description: Left-wing and centrist parties in France are scrambling to block the far-right National Rally from winning the ongoing parliamentary snap election.

item.title: Inside Starbucks' plans to improve stores for customers and baristas
item.description: Starbucks is rolling out changes to barista workflows as it tries to reduce customer wait times.

item.title: 'NEETS' and 'new unemployables' â€” why some young adults arenâ€™t working
item.description: Although the overall unemployment rate is just 4%, there is a growing share of young adults not working â€” by choice or by force.

item.title: Google invests in BlackRock-backed Taiwanese solar developer to boost energy capacity amid AI boom
item.description: Google announced it is partnering with BlackRock to develop a 1-gigawatt pipeline of new solar capacity in Taiwan.

item.title: A new index is using AI tools to measure U.S. economic growth in a broader way
item.description: The Zeta Economic Index, launched Monday, uses generative artificial intelligence to analyze what its developers call "trillions of behavioral signals."

item.title: Boston Celtics' majority owner puts team up for sale weeks after NBA championship
item.description: The ownership group behind the Boston Celtics has put the team up for sale, weeks after it won the NBA championship.

item.title: We're changing our rating and price target on a beauty stock tied to China
item.description: Every weekday, the Investing Club releases the Homestretch; an actionable afternoon update just in time for the last hour of trading.
